action.text: Allie Borcena assigned to Adriane Roa

full_threads.body:
Site: https://themisml.com.au/

Context form Gemini below:

https://gemini.google.com/gem/b2401e098928/b3d9c50cb6207a66

----


Here are the proofreading findings for the "Themis Medico-Legal" page, focusing on Australian English spelling, grammar, and consistency.

Critical Fixes (Spelling & Grammar)

  • Australian vs. American Spelling

    • Location: "Streamlined Experience" (Seamless booking) & "Our Values" (Client Focus).

    • Issue: Usage of "prioritize" (US spelling).

    • Correction: Change to prioritise.

    • Location: "Our Values" (Timeliness & Efficiency).

    • Issue: Usage of "recognize" (US spelling).

    • Correction: Change to recognise.

  • Subject-Verb Agreement

    • Location: "About Themis" (Left column, 2nd paragraph).

    • Issue: "...Dr Shaw's extensive expertise and experience ensures new experts..."

    • Correction: Change to ensure. The subject is compound (expertise + experience), requiring a plural verb.

Consistency & Punctuation

  • Hyphenation (Consistency)

    • Location: "Our Values" (Integrity & Objectivity / Excellence).

    • Issue: "medico legal" is missing the hyphen in these two boxes, but is hyphenated elsewhere on the page (e.g., in the "Compassion & Respect" box).

    • Correction: Change to medico-legal.

  • Compound Adjectives

    • Location: "Our Values" (Excellence).

    • Issue: "...effective and up to date medico legal services..."

    • Correction: Change to up-to-date.

Stylistic Suggestions

  • Repetition

    • Location: "About Themis" (Right column, last paragraph).

    • Issue: "The team... are committed to ensuring that all reports are thorough... to ensure the highest quality..."

    • Correction: Replace the second instance with guarantee or deliver to avoid repetitive wording.

  • Possessive vs. Plural

    • Location: "Streamlined Experience" (Finding the right expert).

    • Context: "...match the perfect expert to your client's needs."

    • Note: "Client's" implies a single client. If the target audience (lawyers) handles multiple clients simultaneously, clients' (plural possessive) may be more accurate.

(Review based on visual analysis of screencapture-themisml-au-about-us-2025-12-10-09_12_45.jpg)

Strategic Follow-up Questions

  1. Would you like me to rewrite the "About Themis" section to be more concise for better mobile scannability, as highlighted in the Wolf IQ Plan as a key value add? 1

  2. Should we standardize the use of "The team is" (singular) versus "The team are" (plural) across the entire site to ensure a consistent brand voice?

  3. Are there specific SEO keywords for the "medico-legal" industry you want ensured are present in these descriptions?
